nodes.text:
Victoria. I've been waiting three years for this.

Are you enjoying your cell? I had it assembled just for you.
nodes.comment: Audio Event: GC_341_FAMILY_REUNION, Fade In, Set Viewscreen: Victoria2

nodes.text:
Gloat all you like, cousin. Your victory will be short-lived.

Your pathetic little army may have carried you this far, but if you think that you can challenge the core systems, you're sadly mistaken. Our glorious army will grind your Restoration to a bloody pulp.

Save me the lecture and tell me what you were doing on Anvelt.

Your father rules the Directorate. You should be in a tower somewhere, not on a dusty little moon guarding a smuggling ship.

"Smuggling ship." Is that what Karosas thought the Newgrange was? Is that what he told you? Oh, you poor, dear fool. I would tell you what you've just done, but I don't want to spoil the surprise. You'll find out for yourself soon enough.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Origin: Betrayed]</color> If Karosas deliberately misled us about this, I'll have his head.
This is all bluster, Lady Arano. She's trying to get into your head.
We may need to have a talk with Lord Karosas.
I can tell you what the Newgrange is now: a smoldering heap of scrap metal. Good job protecting her, by the way.

nodes.text: Worry about it later, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. For now, I would have words with my cousin. Victoria, I loved you like a sister. And you betrayed me. Your father held a knife to my back, and you helped him push it in. I need to understand why.
It isn't working. You know, Victoria… I loved you like a sister. And you betrayed me. Your father held a knife to my back, and you helped him push it in. I need to understand why.

If you'd ever really listened to him, you'd already know.

He tried to teach you, cousin. To set you on the path to strength and prosperity. But you spat on his efforts and forced his hand—and mine along with it!
Forced your hand?! Mastiff is dead because of you! Our mentor, the man who taught you to pilot a 'Mech—you put him in a camp and left him to rot! Thousands of Aurigan dead lie piled at your feet!

The price of strength, and our nation's future.

For the glory of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAuriganReach],Reach]], I'd pay it a hundred times over.

You seem to be confusing wanton cruelty for strength. They aren't the same thing.

The destruction of your lance should have taught you that.

Little Lord Madeira. Still my cousin's favorite pet, I see… I wonder if that pretty jaw of yours is as fragile as it looks.

One of these days, we'll have to find out.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Background: Solaris Gladiator]</color> If you were a real MechWarrior, you'd be picking a fight with me, not with him.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Background: Frontier Freelancer]</color> You remind me of a war criminal I tangled with when I was working the Frontier. She wound up in a cage, too.
Big talk from the woman in the cell. Too bad you can't back it up.
You aren't in a great position to be making threats.
After what you did to Raju Montgomery, I should have you vented into space.

nodes.text:
Don't you worry, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. I'll take my revenge on you soon enough.

Our teacher's death will look mild by comparison.

You won't get the opportunity. I'm going to keep you caged until this war is over, Victoria—you'll watch from the sidelines as I dismantle your father's empire and reclaim my rightful throne.

When the war is over, you'll stand before a jury for your crimes against the Aurigan people. I imagine it'll be a short trial.

I'll break any cage you put me in, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. And then I will hunt you down.

Our teacher's death will look mild by comparison.

You will do nothing but rot in your cage.

Your story is over, Victoria. You've lost.

Is that what you think? Do you honestly believe my father hasn't planned for this?

My capture means nothing! The jaws of our trap are already closing around your neck. You're just too blind to see it!

{COMMANDER.Callsign} is right—you can't. And that's eating you alive, isn't it? You're a formidable MechWarrior, Victoria… but that's all you are. Take away your 'Mech and what's left? Bile and venom and hollow threats.

My threats aren't hollow, fool. Do you think my father hasn't planned for this? Did you think that you were winning?! My capture means nothing! The jaws of our trap are already closing around your neck. You're just too blind to see it!

{COMMANDER.Callsign} is right—you aren't. And that's eating you alive, isn't it? You're a formidable MechWarrior, Victoria… but that's all you are. Take away your 'Mech and what's left? Bile and venom… and nothing else.

Go on and gloat, fool. Enjoy your small victories while you can. Do you think my father hasn't planned for this? Did you think that you were winning?! My capture means nothing! The jaws of our trap are already closing around your neck. You're just too blind to see it!

I'll admit, it's tempting. But I believe that our teacher would prefer me to keep her caged.

Do you hear me, Victoria? You can watch from the sidelines as I dismantle your father's empire and reclaim my rightful throne. And then, when the war is over, you will be tried for your crimes against the Aurigan people.

Is that supposed to scare me, Kamea? It doesn't. Do you think my father hasn't planned for this? Did you think that you were winning?! My capture means nothing! The jaws of our trap are already closing around your neck. You're just too blind to see it!

branches.responseText: We may be blind, but that didn't stop us from kicking your ass up and down the canyons of Anvelt.
For such a genius, your old man is losing an awful lot of ground.
You talk like a cartoon villain. Has anyone ever told you that?

nodes.text: You mock me at your peril, mercenary. My father bends everyone to his will—the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreRimwardPeriphery],Periphery]] nations, the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSuccessorState],Successor States]]… everyone! You don't know what I've done for our people, the sacrifices I've had to make… you understand nothing, and you never will! You've already lost this war, cousin! You'll die screaming, and your Restoration will die with you!

You doubt him at your peril. My father bends everyone to his will—the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreRimwardPeriphery],Rimward Periphery]] nations, the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSuccessorState],Successor States]]… everyone! You don't know what I've done for our people, the sacrifices I've had to make… you understand nothing, and you never will! You've already lost this war, cousin! You'll die screaming, and your Restoration will die with you!
I've heard enough. Mr. Oliveira, cut off her comm.
What do you want us to do with her, Lady Arano? The Argo isn't a prison—she can't stay here.

No. She can't. Lord Karosas lost a daughter to the Directorate, and we weren't there to help him. I can't undo that wrong, but I can give him justice. We will transfer Lady Victoria into his custody, to be held until I say otherwise.

Your call, Lady Arano. We'll set a course for Smithon.

Conversation's over, people. Let's get back to work.

In due time, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. For now, I would have words with my cousin. Victoria, I loved you like a sister. And you betrayed me. Your father held a knife to my back, and you helped him push it in. I need to understand why.
Sooner or later, we'll face off again, MechWarrior. And when that day comes, I will shear your cockpit in two.
Victoria, I loved you like a sister. And you betrayed me. Your father held a knife to my back, and you helped him push it in. I need to understand why.
